column14: Description
The computer does nothing
Copies RSYS to RA
Copies RSYS to RB
Copies RSYS to RC
Copies RSYS to RX
Copies RSYS to RY
Copies RSYS to RRADR
Copies RSYS to RWADR
Copies R[a2] to R[a1]
Adds RA and RB together and stores the result to R[a1]
Incerements RA by RSYS and stores the result ot R[a2]
Subtracts RA and RB together and stores the result to RA
Decrements RA by RSYS and stores the result ot R[a2]
Outputs the result of the bitwise OR operation on RA and RB
Outputs the bitwise OR of RA and RSYS to R[a2]
Outputs the result of the bitwise AND operation on RA and RB
Outputs the bitwise AND of RA and  RSYS to R[a2]
Outputs the result of the bitwise XOR operation on RA and RB
Outputs the bitwise XOR of RA and  RSYS to R[a2]
Puthe the inverted RA to R[a1]
Outputs RA shifted to the right by 1 bit (divided by 2) to R[a1]
Outputs RA shifted to the left by 1 bit (multiplied by 2) to R[a1]
Compares R[a1] with R[a2] and sets RC to 0: =, 1: <, 2: >
Compares RSYS with R[a2] and sets RC to 0: =, 1: <, 2: >
Loads the value from the flags register to R[a1]
Loads the value from memory to R[a1]
Stores RSYS to memory
Stores R[a1] to memory
Copies the data from the read address to the write address in memory
Pushes RSYS to the stack
Pushes R[a1] to the stack
pops the value from the stack to R[a1]
Jumps to the given address
Jumps to the given address, and stores the source address to the call stack
Jumps to the given address, if the overflow flag is on
Jumps to the given address, if the negative flag is on
Jumps to the given address, if the zero flag is on
Returns from the subroutine
Returns from the current interrupt
Puts R[a1] to port[a2]
Loads the value from port[a2]  to R[a1]
Stops the clock, and execution
